author: kdoemelt
post_text: May 14, 2015 at 1:06 AM#1Does anyone know what the "Stage" special setting does?This is for presets, and is like the "Default" and "Highlight" settings but does not seem to do anything.I stumbled on this by accident, not sure if it an undocumented feature, something yet to be implemented, or I just haven't figured out it use yet.If anyone knows, please share, if not, don't worry about it. I was just curious.

posts.author: kdoemelt
posts.post_text: May 14, 2015 at 1:06 AM#1Does anyone know what the "Stage" special setting does?This is for presets, and is like the "Default" and "Highlight" settings but does not seem to do anything.I stumbled on this by accident, not sure if it an undocumented feature, something yet to be implemented, or I just haven't figured out it use yet.If anyone knows, please share, if not, don't worry about it. I was just curious.

posts.author: kdoemelt
posts.post_text: May 14, 2015 at 3:49 AM#3Glad,I see, this is part of the calibration sub-routine. Didn't even notice this in the fixture menu.I was looking in the preset directories, I use the default and highlight special mode all the time, but didn't see the purpose for this mode, until now.I guess you could use this to create the 4 corners as position presets before you even start the calibration setup. Don't know if that is useful or not, it is an awesome tool, but I use it so rarely. The down side of doing one offs I guess.Thanks again Glad!

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: May 14, 2015 at 9:01 AM#4similar to how Highlight values, is intended to temporary make the fixture as visible as possible, without messing with your programmer (typically dimmer>full, colors>white), the Stage values, is intended to temporary make the fixturebeam as narrow as possible, (Zoom>Narrow, Iris>closed), for better accuracy when adjusting the corners of the stage.

title: /Special=Stage
